comments:
I've installed new Mylar (0.4.2.1) using update, restarted and can not find my
old tasks.
Moreover, when I add new tasks and restart Eclipse, I don't see them too.

That's very strange and bad--could you please attach the contents of your
<workspace>/.metadata/.log file?

The problem could be that a wrong version of Mylar got installed via the update site.
 I suggest reinstalling by following the "incompatible version of Eclipse" instructions
at: http://eclipse.org/mylar/doc/faq.html#install-failure

Please let me know if this
works.

I've uninstalled and reinstalled Mylar, but still see same problem.

Konstantin,

That message is bug 115496, but has not been known to cause any bad behavior. 
However, if you see it on 0.4.2.1 let me know so that I reopen that bug.

More imporantly, if this is the only failure that you see then Mylar should
work, and you should be able to create tasks and activate them.  If you use the
same workspace as before then your old tasks should show up (they are stored in
<workspace>/.mylar/tasklist.xml, unless you changed this in the preferences). 
Please let me know if anything is failing.
Konstantin, did this get resolved by following the steps in comment#4?
This update site issue has been resolved for 0.4.2.1 and later releases.
